page.title: 14Transport in Bramdean
page.content: Transport is of great importance in Bramdean as most education, work, entertainments and services such as doctor's etc. are outside the village. The public bus service runs 5 buses per day to the nearest market town (4 miles) and the nearest bus and train station (9 miles). There is no service on Sunday, or return bus after 5.30pm. This severely limits evening activities for those without their own transport. The times of these buses also make it inconvenient for people who work extended hours. A large proportion of the households have a car, though in many cases this is not available while the main bread winner is at work. There is a considerable problem for elderly people without a car. Walking to the nearest village is dangerous as the busy main road has no pavement.
